author: More-Consequence-614
text:
He didnt make of fun out of Mbappé, the Argentine squad were singing a common stadium song, which may sound harsh for europeans since they dont have the mocking culture but its all in good fun. Everytime we play a football game with friends the winners sings it.

Its a little banter nothing else, the fact they said Mbappé means they know he was the most important player in France.

text:

author: rafasaraiva
text: They have literally thousands of songs mocking brazil and our best players, as we do to them. Its part of the footballing culture around here.

author: jordenwuj
text: lmao if that's the case then it really is just banter and not taken seriously. very different culture would be interesting if they had beaten someone like japan or korea in the final lmao

author: bastaderobarme
text:
If Japan or Korea had a godlike player like Mbappe that carried the entire team, then sure, we would be making fun of him too because he pretty much represents the entire team. If it had been just a good solid team, then I guess we would replace the word Mbappe for "Japan" or "Korea" or we may simply decide to just... make fun of Brazil LOL.

Mbappe did say that he thought European teams were superior to south americans so he pretty much made himself a target for the songs. People here were also upset at him before the world cup because he pushed messi on his team in a match so the memes are targeting him as well. The songs/memes are all in good fun though. No hate, just how we celebrate :)
